content.value_statement: An AI skill for Claude, Codex, and Claude Code
actual_capabilities: Generate comprehensive design tokens from brand colors including color palettes, typography scales, spacing grids, shadows, and animations
Create component system architecture with consistent design patterns
Calculate responsive design breakpoints and grid systems
Export design tokens in multiple formats (JSON, CSS, SCSS)
limitations: Requires Python runtime to execute the design token generator script
Limited to three predefined style options (modern, classic, playful)
Does not include visual design tools or prototyping capabilities
Focuses on token generation rather than full design implementation

use_cases.title: Design System Initialization
use_cases.description: Quickly bootstrap a new design system from a brand color, generating a complete set of design tokens including colors, typography, spacing, and component styles.
use_cases.target_user: UI designers starting new projects or redesigns

use_cases.title: Brand Consistency
use_cases.description: Maintain visual consistency across products by generating systematic design tokens that enforce brand guidelines and color relationships.
use_cases.target_user: Design teams working on multi-product ecosystems

use_cases.title: Design-to-Dev Handoff
use_cases.description: Streamline the handoff process by generating developer-ready design tokens in CSS, SCSS, or JSON format with clear documentation.
use_cases.target_user: UI designers collaborating with frontend developers

prompt_templates.title: Generate Design Tokens
prompt_templates.prompt: Generate a complete design system with tokens for colors, typography, spacing, and components using brand color #3B82F6 in a modern style. Export as CSS variables.
prompt_templates.scenario: Starting a new project and need a complete token system

prompt_templates.title: Create Component Documentation
prompt_templates.prompt: Document the button component architecture including variants, states, sizing options, and accessibility requirements for our design system.
prompt_templates.scenario: Standardizing component patterns across the team

prompt_templates.title: Calculate Responsive Breakpoints
prompt_templates.prompt: Generate responsive breakpoints and grid system specifications for a mobile-first design system targeting mobile, tablet, and desktop viewports.

output_examples.input: Generate design tokens in SCSS format for a playful brand style

best_practices: Start with a primary brand color and let the generator create systematic color relationships
Choose a style (modern, classic, or playful) that aligns with your brand personality
Export tokens in the format that matches your development stack (CSS for vanilla, SCSS for preprocessors, JSON for JS frameworks)
Review generated tokens for accessibility compliance, especially color contrast ratios
Document component usage patterns alongside token definitions for better team alignment
Use the 8pt spacing grid consistently across all components for visual harmony
anti_patterns: Manually editing generated token files instead of regenerating from source parameters
Mixing custom tokens with generated ones without documenting the deviations
Skipping accessibility validation before implementing tokens in production
Using different export formats across the same project, causing inconsistencies
Generating tokens without considering the target platform's constraints (web, mobile, etc.)
Ignoring responsive breakpoints and using fixed pixel values throughout the design

faq.question: What file formats can the design token generator export to?
faq.answer: The generator supports three export formats: JSON for JavaScript frameworks and tooling, CSS for native CSS custom properties, and SCSS for Sass preprocessor workflows.

faq.question: How do I customize the generated color palette?
faq.answer: Provide your brand's primary color as a hex value and select a style (modern, classic, or playful). The generator will automatically create a systematic palette with light and dark variants, complementary colors, and semantic tokens.

faq.question: Does this skill replace visual design tools like Figma?
faq.answer: No, this skill complements visual design tools by generating systematic design tokens and documentation. It focuses on the architectural and systematic aspects of design systems, not visual design or prototyping.

faq.question: How does the spacing grid system work?
faq.answer: The generator uses an 8pt grid system, creating spacing tokens in multiples of 8 pixels (8px, 16px, 24px, 32px, etc.). This ensures consistent spacing and easier alignment across components and layouts.
